results.title: Lockington Living Heritage Complex
results.creator_credit: David Meagher, Astrid Scott and ACMI
results.brief_description: Celebrating and preserving the rich history of Lockington and its surrounding district, the dedicated and hard working volunteers of the Lockington Living Heritage Complex take us on a tour of the complex with the highlight being ‘The Big Shed’ which at 106 metres houses a restored Melbourne tram and the first ever pop top caravan, hand built in Lockington.

results.title: On the Black Hill
results.creator_credit: Andrew Grieve, Jennifer Howarth and British Film Institute
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by Bruce Chatwin, this is an unrelenting portrayal of the raw experience of rural farm life in the Welsh border country. Starting in 1895, it focuses on the lives of four generations of a farming community and spans 85 years. At the heart of the story is the intense relationship between identical twin brothers, Benjamin (Mike Gwilym) and Lewis (Robert Gwilym) Jones. The film ultimately expresses the healing nature of time and the promise of the future.

results.title: Lockington Film Premiere: ACMI in the Regions
results.brief_description: In July 2008, the ACMI Content Development crew spent four days in Lockington and produced five short documentary films. The premier screening of these short films took place on the 15th of January 2009, on a hot and humid Thursday evening in the Lockington & District Community Centre. Over 200 locals joined Tony Sweeney and Kim Montgomery, from ACMI, and Louise Ross, a local and chief community organiser, to showcase the films and celebrate the stories that make Lockington a thriving and unique regional town. This film of the premiere screenings captures the excitement of the locals with a red carpet arrival for all the guests, the handing out of DVDs to all individuals that were involved in the project and finally vox pops from the audience members as they share with us their appreciation and pride for the films.

results.title: Living in Locky: The Youth Perspective
results.creator_credit: David Withers, Astrid Scott and ACMI
results.brief_description: 17 year old Locky local, Emma McInnes interviews a cross section of young people to find out what life in a rural town is really like. What is there to do? What the future holds and the all important question, are there many lookers in Locky?

results.title: Ladies of Lockington
results.creator_credit: Jason White, Astrid Scott and ACMI
results.brief_description: Meet the ladies who are at the heart of Lockington. These passionate and committed women get things done. They network, coordinate, manage and harness the talent that is available to them to improve and enhance the quality of life for all the families of Lockington and surrounding districts.

results.title: It's OUR Business: Lockington and District
results.creator_credit: David Meagher, Astrid Scott and ACMI
results.brief_description: These frank interviews with local business leaders from Lockington and its surrounding district, reveal a place where the spirit of enterprise is alive and well and whole heartedly supported by the community.

results.title: On the Beach
results.creator_credit: Stanley Kramer, United Artists Corporation and Lomitas Productions
results.brief_description: On the Beach is one of the most celebrated anti-nuclear films in motion picture history. Based on the novel by Nevil Shute, it is the story of US Naval commander Dwight Towers, who is sent to assist Australian authorities after the rest of the world has been devastated by a nuclear holocaust.

constellations_other.name: Great southern land?
constellations_other.description: Australia is often mythologised in film and TV, but national myths must not only be embraced, but resisted.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Stanley Kramer, United Artists Corporation and Lomitas Productions
results.description: ‘On the Beach’ is one of the most celebrated anti-nuclear films in motion picture history. Based on the novel by Nevil Shute, it is the story of US Naval commander Dwight Towers, who is sent to assist Australian authorities after the rest of the world has been devastated by a nuclear holocaust. Towers must attempt to save a small group of survivors as impending doom approaches.

Towers must attempt to save a small group of survivors as impending doom approaches.

results.title: On target marketing: retailing and services; manufacturing
results.creator_credit: Paul Humfress, Tony Coyte and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Marketing techniques are described and illustrated through a sequence of case studies which show how successful small business owners developed a marketing strategy which contributed to the growth and increased profitability of their businesses. This program takes examples of small businesses from the manufacturing, retail and service sectors.

results.title: On stage please at Hackney Empire
results.creator_credit: David E. Naughton, David L. Watkins and David E Naughton Film and Television Productions
results.brief_description: An historical account of one of Britain’s last-standing music hall theatres, the Hackney Empire. Opened in 1901 this wonderful theatre became the home for many famous British music hall artists and entertainers right up into the 1950s when it was finally closed down in 1956. However, against all odds, the music theatre has survived and this film documents the re-opening in 1989 with interviews, personal reminiscings, stills, archival footage and live performances from past and present entertainers including Bernard Bresslaw, Roy Hudd, Chas ‘n’ Dave, Helen shapiro, Frankie Vaughan, Tommy Trinder, Barbara Windsor, Larry Adler and many more. Also features the Royal Artillery Orchestra. Variety at its best.
